intro: Dryandra stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Dryandra stricta is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and heathland environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence.
